values: I visited CT and NY last weekend to spend time with two of the closest people in my life. It was an amazing journey from beginning to end, that's for sure! ;-) I have loads of memories and pictures to last a lifetime....and look forward to making more soon! :-) Some of the pics are Lake Tagasoke, NY The path to the lake Some tree shots by the lake John in one of the tress by the lake *grin* Gemma by the lake, with her new staff LoL ;-) A nice shot of the light falling just right on her ELF shirt (appropriately enough) *smiles* These are just a few. I have loads. TONS! I went nuts....from the time I pulled out of my driveway until I pulled back into it. ;-) I had a BLAST! (even getting lost isn't so bad now lol) MUCH much more to come.... *smiles*
"A photograph is neither taken nor seized by force. It offers itself up. It is the photo that takes you. One must not take photos." - Henri Cartier-Bresson

From last night's celebrations.....a look through my eyes. :-) I didn't get the best of shots, but I had fun. These really were MUCH better in person. Honest. ;-) I just had to share a few of my first firework photos ever. I found some words to go with them as well..... I hope everyone had a wonderful Independence Day! "I will not forsake The colors that you bring The nights you filled with fireworks..." U2 - Stuck In A Moment

I found this lovely meadow. It went on for some length. I had to find a poem fitting before I could post it. It's just so beautiful. My photo really does it no justice at all. I just wanted to share. To Meadows By Robert Herrick 1591-1674 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- YE have been fresh and green, Ye have been fill'd with flowers, And ye the walks have been Where maids have spent their hours. You have beheld how they With wicker arks did come To kiss and bear away The richer cowslips home. You've heard them sweetly sing, And seen them in a round: Each virgin like a spring, With honeysuckles crown'd. But now we see none here Whose silv'ry feet did tread And with dishevell'd hair Adorn'd this smoother mead. Like unthrifts, having spent Your stock and needy grown, You're left here to lament Your poor estates, alone.

Well, I got my new graphic program installed. Yippee!! It's going to be fun trying to teach myself TWO new programs at once. LoL! I'm going to though, or this idea won't go very far. (About as far as that book idea from about 5 years ago, heh =p) My latest little nothings are Purple Landscape GreenMountain Erosion Glass Rings Golden Isle Bubble They're not much, but they're mine. That's all that matters. I may get the hang of this 3d thing yet. *grin* Each page is linked but it's better to use the back button since there is no link back here. Sorry!
